snippet: At Merion Golf Club’s East Course, the holes are marked by red, egg-shaped wicker baskets attached to steel sticks, not the traditional flags that wave with the wind.
abstract: Holes at East Course of Merion Golf Club, site of 2013 United States Open, are marked by red, egg-shaped wicker baskets attached to steel sticks instead of traditional flags that wave with the wind.
lead_paragraph: At Merion Golf Club’s East Course, the holes are marked by red, egg-shaped wicker baskets attached to steel sticks, not the traditional flags that wave with the wind.

headline.seo: U.S. Open — No Flags at Merion, But Wicker Baskets Instead
headline.main: Wicker Baskets, Not Flags, Adorn Merion Golf Course
headline.print_headline: Flags? At Idiosyncratic Merion, They Prefer Wicker
